questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML is the standard markup language used to create web pages.
questions.help: HTML is essential for structuring web content.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define the footer of a document?
questions.explanation: The <footer> element is used to specify a footer for a document or section.
questions.help: Footers typically contain author information, copyright, or related documents.

questions.question: Which of the following is a JavaScript framework?
questions.explanation: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, often used in single-page applications.
questions.help: Frameworks help streamline development by providing pre-written code for common tasks.

questions.question: What is the correct syntax for referring to an external script called 'script.js'?
questions.explanation: The 'src' attribute is used to specify the URL of the external script file.
questions.help: Always use 'src' for external JavaScript files in your HTML.

questions.question: Which CSS property controls the text size?
questions.explanation: The 'font-size' property is used to set the size of the font.
questions.help: You can use units like 'px', 'em', or '%' to define font size.

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS is used to control the layout and style of a webpage.
questions.help: CSS allows for the separation of content and presentation.

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid CSS selector?
questions.explanation: All options are valid CSS selectors for targeting elements.
questions.help: ID selectors use '#', class selectors use '.', and type selectors use the element name.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in an tag?
choices: To provide alternative text for the image
To add a border to the image
questions.correctAnswer: To provide alternative text for the image
questions.explanation: The 'alt' attribute provides text when an image cannot be displayed.
questions.help: Using 'alt' text improves accessibility for visually impaired users.

questions.question: Which method is used to select an element with a specific ID in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The getElementById() method returns the element that has the ID attribute with the specified value.
questions.help: This method is commonly used to manipulate specific elements on a page.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of using frameworks in web development?
questions.explanation: Frameworks provide tools and libraries that help streamline development processes.
questions.help: Frameworks often come with pre-built functions, making coding more efficient.

questions.question: What does the 'position' property in CSS do?
choices: Sets the position of an element
Defines how an element is positioned in the document
questions.explanation: The 'position' property controls the positioning method used for an element.
questions.help: Common values include static, relative, absolute, fixed, and sticky.

questions.question: Which of the following is a backend technology?
questions.explanation: Node.js is a runtime environment that allows for server-side scripting using JavaScript.
questions.help: Backend technologies handle the server-side logic of web applications.

questions.question: What is a RESTful API?
choices: A method for interacting with databases
An architectural style for designing networked applications
A way to create mobile applications
questions.correctAnswer: An architectural style for designing networked applications
questions.explanation: RESTful APIs use HTTP requests to access and use data.
questions.help: They are stateless and rely on standard HTTP methods like GET, POST, PUT, DELETE.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to create a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The <a> element is used to define hyperlinks that link to other web pages.
questions.help: Use the 'href' attribute to specify the URL of the page the link goes to.

questions.question: What is the difference between '== and '===' in JavaScript?
choices: == checks for value equality, while === checks for both value and type equality
== checks for type equality, while === checks for value equality
questions.correctAnswer: == checks for value equality, while === checks for both value and type equality
questions.explanation: '==' performs type coercion, while '===' does not.
questions.help: Use '===' for strict comparisons to avoid unexpected results.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'viewport' meta tag in HTML?
choices: To control the layout on mobile browsers
To specify the title of the page
questions.correctAnswer: To control the layout on mobile browsers
questions.explanation: The viewport meta tag allows for responsive web design by controlling the layout on different devices.
questions.help: It helps ensure your website is mobile-friendly.

questions.question: What does AJAX stand for?
questions.explanation: AJAX allows web pages to be updated asynchronously by exchanging data with a web server.
questions.help: AJAX enables dynamic and interactive web applications.

questions.question: What is the primary function of a web server?
questions.explanation: A web server stores, processes, and delivers web pages to clients.
questions.help: Web servers handle requests via HTTP and HTTPS.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the background color of an element?
questions.explanation: The 'background-color' property sets the background color of an element.
questions.help: You can use color names, hex codes, or RGB values.

questions.question: What does the term 'responsive web design' refer to?
choices: Web design that adapts to different screen sizes
Web design that uses fixed layouts
questions.correctAnswer: Web design that adapts to different screen sizes
questions.explanation: Responsive web design ensures that web pages render well on various devices.
questions.help: Techniques include fluid grids and flexible images.

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid JavaScript data type?
questions.explanation: JavaScript has several data types, including strings, booleans, and numbers.
questions.help: Understanding data types is crucial for effective programming.

questions.question: What does the 'z-index' property in CSS control?
choices: The order of elements on the page
questions.correctAnswer: The order of elements on the page
questions.explanation: 'z-index' determines the stack order of elements that overlap.
questions.help: Elements with a higher z-index are displayed in front of those with a lower z-index.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'data-*' attribute in HTML?
questions.explanation: The 'data-*' attribute allows you to store extra information on standard elements.
questions.help: You can access this data using JavaScript.

questions.question: Which protocol is commonly used for secure web communications?
questions.explanation: HTTPS is the secure version of HTTP, using encryption for data transfer.
questions.help: Always use HTTPS to protect user data.

questions.question: Which of the following is a CSS framework?
questions.explanation: Bootstrap is a popular CSS framework for building responsive websites.
questions.help: Frameworks can significantly speed up your development process.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'console.log()' method in JavaScript?
choices: To output data to the console
questions.correctAnswer: To output data to the console
questions.explanation: console.log() is used for debugging purposes to print messages to the web console.
questions.help: It's a valuable tool for tracking the flow of code execution.

questions.question: What is the function of the 'fetch()' method in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The fetch() method is used to make network requests to retrieve resources.
questions.help: It's often used with asynchronous programming to handle responses.

questions.question: What is a CSS Grid Layout?
choices: A layout system for positioning elements
questions.correctAnswer: A layout system for positioning elements
questions.explanation: CSS Grid Layout is a two-dimensional layout system for web pages.
questions.help: It allows you to create complex responsive web layouts.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a 'DOCTYPE' declaration in HTML?
choices: To define the HTML version being used
questions.correctAnswer: To define the HTML version being used
questions.explanation: The DOCTYPE declaration informs the web browser about the HTML version to expect.
questions.help: It helps ensure proper rendering of the page.

questions.question: What does the term 'minification' refer to in web development?
questions.explanation: Minification removes unnecessary characters from code without changing its functionality.
questions.help: It improves loading times by reducing file sizes.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid JavaScript loop?
questions.explanation: While 'for', 'while', and 'do...while' are valid JavaScript loops, 'foreach' is not a standalone loop in JavaScript.
questions.help: You can use 'forEach' with arrays, but it's a method, not a loop structure.

questions.question: What is Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)?
choices: A security feature that allows restricted resources
A way to share cookies between sites
A method for loading resources faster
questions.correctAnswer: A security feature that allows restricted resources
questions.explanation: CORS is a security feature that restricts web pages from making requests to a different domain.
questions.help: CORS allows servers to specify who can access their resources.

questions.question: What is the primary use of the 'async' attribute in a <script> tag?
choices: To block rendering until the script is loaded
questions.explanation: The 'async' attribute allows the script to be executed asynchronously with the rest of the page.
questions.help: This can improve loading performance and user experience.

questions.question: What is the difference between HTML and XHTML?
choices: HTML is case-sensitive, while XHTML is not
XHTML does not allow empty elements
questions.explanation: XHTML is a stricter and cleaner version of HTML based on XML principles.
questions.help: Use proper closing tags and nesting with XHTML.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to control the layout of a flex container?
questions.explanation: The display, flex, and flex-direction properties are used to control the flexbox layout.
questions.help: Flexbox is great for building responsive layouts.

questions.question: What does the term 'callback' refer to in JavaScript?
choices: A function executed after another function completes
A way to loop through an array
questions.correctAnswer: A function executed after another function completes
questions.explanation: A callback is a function passed into another function as an argument and is executed later.
questions.help: Callbacks are essential for asynchronous programming.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in JavaScript?
choices: To refer to the global object
To refer to the calling object
questions.correctAnswer: To refer to the calling object
questions.explanation: The 'this' keyword refers to the object that is currently executing the function.
questions.help: Understanding 'this' is crucial for object-oriented programming in JavaScript.

questions.question: What is a media query in CSS?
choices: A way to style media files
A method for loading media files
questions.explanation: Media queries allow you to apply styles based on the viewport's characteristics.
questions.help: They help create adaptable layouts for different devices.

questions.question: What does the term 'SEO' stand for?
questions.explanation: SEO is the practice of improving the ranking of a website in search engine results.
questions.help: Effective SEO can increase website traffic.

questions.question: Which HTML attribute specifies an alternate text for an image?
questions.explanation: The 'alt' attribute provides alternative text for an image if it cannot be displayed.
questions.help: This is important for accessibility.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'form' element in HTML?
choices: To create interactive forms for user input
To define a section of a webpage
questions.correctAnswer: To create interactive forms for user input
questions.explanation: The 'form' element is used to collect user input.
questions.help: Forms can include text fields, buttons, checkboxes, and more.

questions.question: What is the function of the 'validate()' method in JavaScript?
choices: To check the correctness of an input
To send form data to the server
questions.correctAnswer: To check the correctness of an input
questions.explanation: The validate() method is used to check if the input data meets certain criteria.
questions.help: Validation helps ensure data integrity before submission.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a JavaScript event?
questions.explanation: Click, submit, and load are all events that can trigger JavaScript functions.
questions.help: Events are crucial for interactive web applications.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'float' property in CSS?
choices: To position an element to the left or right
To control the stacking order of elements
questions.correctAnswer: To position an element to the left or right
questions.explanation: The 'float' property is used for positioning and layout in CSS.
questions.help: It's often used to create text wraps around images.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define an unordered list?
questions.explanation: The <ul> tag defines an unordered list in HTML.
questions.help: Items in the list are typically marked with bullet points.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'debugger' statement in JavaScript?
choices: To pause code execution for debugging
questions.correctAnswer: To pause code execution for debugging
questions.explanation: The 'debugger' statement stops the execution of JavaScript and calls the debugger.
questions.help: It's useful for troubleshooting code.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a CSS reset?
questions.explanation: A CSS reset is used to minimize browser inconsistencies in default styling.
questions.help: It helps achieve a consistent look across different browsers.

questions.question: What is a CDN?
questions.explanation: A CDN is a system of distributed servers that deliver web content based on the user's location.
questions.help: CDNs improve loading speed and reliability.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'transform' property in CSS?
choices: To change the position of an element
questions.explanation: The 'transform' property allows you to rotate, scale, and translate elements.
questions.help: Transforms can enhance visual design and user experience.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to create a comment in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: JavaScript comments can be single-line (//) or multi-line (/* */).
questions.help: Comments are crucial for documentation and code readability.

questions.question: What is the role of a web browser?
questions.explanation: Web browsers retrieve, present, and navigate information on the World Wide Web.
questions.help: Popular browsers include Chrome, Firefox, and Safari.

questions.question: What is the difference between padding and margin in CSS?
choices: Padding is inside an element, margin is outside
Margin is inside an element, padding is outside
questions.correctAnswer: Padding is inside an element, margin is outside
questions.explanation: Padding creates space within an element, while margin creates space outside of it.
questions.help: Understanding the box model is crucial for layout design.

questions.question: What does the 'hover' pseudo-class do in CSS?
choices: Styles an element when the user hovers over it
Styles an element when it is clicked
Styles an element when it is focused
questions.correctAnswer: Styles an element when the user hovers over it
questions.explanation: The 'hover' pseudo-class applies styles to elements when a user hovers their cursor over them.
questions.help: It's commonly used for interactive elements like buttons.

questions.question: What is the function of the 'localStorage' object in JavaScript?
choices: To store data locally in the browser
questions.correctAnswer: To store data locally in the browser
questions.explanation: The 'localStorage' object allows you to store key-value pairs in a web browser with no expiration time.
questions.help: It's useful for saving user preferences and application state.

questions.question: What is a CSS selector?
choices: A way to select HTML elements to style
questions.correctAnswer: A way to select HTML elements to style
questions.explanation: CSS selectors are patterns used to select elements you want to style.
questions.help: Common selectors include class, ID, and element selectors.

questions.question: What is the function of the 'splice()' method in JavaScript?
choices: To add or remove elements from an array
questions.correctAnswer: To add or remove elements from an array
questions.explanation: The splice() method changes the contents of an array by removing or replacing existing elements.
questions.help: It can also insert new elements at a specified index.

questions.question: What does the 'display' property in CSS control?
choices: The box model of an element
The layout behavior of an element
questions.correctAnswer: The layout behavior of an element
questions.explanation: The 'display' property specifies the display behavior of an element, such as block, inline, or flex.
questions.help: It influences how elements flow in the layout.

questions.question: What does the 'forEach()' method do in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The forEach() method executes a provided function once for each array element.
questions.help: It's useful for applying a function to each item in an array.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'filter()' method in JavaScript?
choices: To create a new array with elements that pass a test
To add elements to an array
To modify elements in an array
questions.correctAnswer: To create a new array with elements that pass a test
questions.explanation: The filter() method creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function.
questions.help: It's useful for selecting specific items from an array.

questions.question: What does the 'grid-template-columns' property do in CSS Grid?
choices: Defines the number of columns in a grid
questions.correctAnswer: Defines the number of columns in a grid
questions.explanation: The 'grid-template-columns' property specifies the size of the columns in a grid layout.
questions.help: It helps create responsive layouts with varying column sizes.
